page.title: 13Post Office and Stores.
page.content: The Post Office Premises abut onto the S. side of the A. 35 at Morcombelake, offering all the usual Post Office faclities, including a post box and telephone kiosk. The shop has two sections, one for Post Office buisness and another for display and sale of groceries, confectionery and useful household goods.This is the only shop serving Morcombelake and the farms lying N. and S. of the A. 35 road. There is also passing trade from the busy road. The shop is a focal point in the district and appears to serve as a meeting place for neighbours to chat and exchange local news. The village is a scattered one with poor road communications to farms and the shop serves an important social need in addition to it's function of retailing goods.
